column4: SITUATION: A private school in a remote area of a third-world country; no Internet connection on-site (only in the city, where I am now); 60 Windows XP machines to use as clients; want to set up ubuntu as samba server.  QUESTION: For the given situation, is 7.04 better, or is 6.06LTS better?
Nearest Internet connection is about nine miles.
Due to terrain and road conditions, that's about a 45-minute drive.
: without internet how are u in IRC
: this seems the question of the day . rib tickling
: i wonder Honduras is so backward!!! or are you simply crafting out
: a linux server for a windows . which country is that!!
: it can be installed easily no probs
: you are already in city right
: make sure you download all dependent packs also
: best is to get the server and install and then take it back
: pack it up in a cushioned box to resist the bumpy drive. take help of a packer
: i dont think there is any software for that!
must find way to get it to fit through a school-bus door once it has been packaged sufficiently.
: does it open from top!
: try a rescue boat on river
: normally servers never need to update as they are serving a LAN . so once it works there is no need to update. For a school its more than enuf
: but yeah you have to cross the river though
: try apt-get . it recovers with any previously cut package
: why don't you get a  cd shipped
because the postal service is much less reliable.  A post card may take 6-8 weeks, IF it gets there.
it's an odd mix here.  Some things you would not expect to find are easy to get.  Other things that you WOULD expect can be just about unknown.
: then burn a iso image onto a cd/dvd and take it
